description: From mania +‎ -ac. Borrowed from French maniaque, from Late Latin maniacus, from Ancient Greek μανιακός (maniakós), adjectival form of μανία (manía, “madness”).  Doublet of manic.

entries.meaning: An insane person, especially one who suffers from a mania.
examples: She was driving like a maniac.

entries.meaning: A fanatic, a person with an obsession.
